content: description this is an easy pattern that uses basic stitches to make a complex looking texture it uses a bit more yarn but it is well worth it easy to resize this stitch would also make a great baby blanket gauge & sizing gauge isn t very important in this project play around with hook sizes until you find one that makes a fabric you like this pattern is written to produce a washcloth roughly 10 inches by 10 inches if you would like to change the size simply chain the width you d like making sure it s a multiple of 2 then add 1 then 2 more chains abbreviations & stitches used chain = chain skip = skip st = stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet ** = repeat the instructions inside the asterisks the indicated number of times stitches within the parentheses are all worked into the same stitch the number inside brackets indicates the number of stitches in the row materials about 120 yards of cotton or cotton blend yarn such as paintbox yarns cotton aran or dishie from wecrochet a 4 0 mm g/6 hook tapestry needle for weaving in ends stitch markers if desired this pattern is also available for free on my website https //hooksyarnandcats com/2021/04/23/washcloth-3-gritty-washcloth/ copyright© amber killian 2021 amber killian reserves the rights to the pattern you may sell products made from this pattern you may not use the photographs in this pattern to sell your products show off your own beautiful work this pattern is subject to copyright and you may only use it for your personal use you may not reproduce alter or distribute any part of the pattern you may not claim it as your own thank you for respecting my work
